description.narrative: ADAP supported the work of nine rural women's groups (five rural women's associations and four cooperatives) in the cotton-producing zone of Koutiala. The grant helped build the capacity of these women's groups in networking, organizational management, advocacy for their rights, and marketing their agricultural products. The groups acquired much-needed equipment and raw materials for their farming activities. The groups' members benefited from technical training, inter-group learning visits, and participation in a trade fair to showcase their products. The goals of the grant were to increase the social and economic power of nine rural women's groups in Koutiala through building their financial management capacity, training in rural women's rights advocacy, market gardening, and the processing and sale of value-added agricultural products; establish effective regional and transnational network of rural women's groups that extends across the border in Burkina Faso to advocate for rural women's civil and economic rights; and assess the organizational and economic progress of nine rural women's groups in Koutiala with reference to baseline data collected in 2012.
